resources.string:
BatteryBot will be completely closed, and you won\'t see it in your status bar any more.\n
\nIf you just want to leave the main window and keep the indicator running, press Cancel and then just press your device\'s BACK button to leave the main window.

This is BatteryBot, the free version of the BatteryBot family of apps. It\'s available from the Android Market, and it\'s an open source project, which means you can download the source for free from the project website.\n
\nPlease consider donating by upgrading to the Pro Version.

BatteryBot is a lightweight battery indicator for the Android™ mobile operating system. Its core feature is that it provides an icon that lives in the status bar and shows you the percentage of battery charge left.


The Pro version offers a great deal more utility than that, however. Besides offering red, amber, and green icons, it also has the following key features as of version 3.0:


• Fully automated estimated charge/discharge time left. 
• Downloadable icon plugins. 
• Logging of battery state. 
• Manually disable/reenable the device lock screen, with the option to automatically disable it when plugged in and reenable it when unplugged. 
• Many more useful things that you'll discover throughout.

(These are out of my control.)


• There's no way to remove the built-in battery icon. 
• The notification icon in the status bar and the message you see in the notification tray are tied together — you can't have one without the other. 
• Many apps should allow installation to removable storage (SD card); some should not. BatteryBot is of the latter group. See the project FAQ if you'd like further explanation.

• Small, simple, and easy to read. 
• It doesn't do any polling. It receives a broadcast message from the OS when the battery status changes, then it simply updates the icon and goes back to sleep. What this means is that it will take up a small amount of RAM, but essentially 0 CPU cycles, so it can't drain your battery. I estimate that it will cost you about 1 minute of usage time off of a full discharge as a worst case scenario. If you are experiencing anything worse than that, you probably have another app (such as a "task killer" app of some kind) interfering with BatteryBot's normal operation. 
• Easy access to Battery Use screen (requires Android 1.6+). 
• Configure to always start on boot, never start on boot, or start on boot if the app was running on shutdown. 
• Lots more that I'm either forgetting or seem too minor to mention on their on, but that add up to a great app. 
• The satisfaction of supporting the developer. (I really appreciate it!)

This software is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.\n
\nWhile I do my best to make sure that it works well and does not cause problems, I am not responsible for any damage or inconvenience it may cause under any circumstance.

This app would only be available in English without the generous assistance of the volunteer translators. Thanks!


Many thanks are due to Google and all of the open-source coders who made the Android platform and this app possible.


The launcher icon (the upright battery you see in the Market) is based on an icon from the Oxygen icon theme and used under the Creative Common Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 License.

I need help translating this app to new languages and maintaining the existing translations. If you would like to help, please send me an email. Please let me know if and how you would like your name listed in this section in acknowledgment of your assistance.
If you have a question or a problem, please email me.\n
The Pro version has many more settings and features, including colorful icons, alarms, battery state logging, auto/manual lock screen disable, charge/discharge remaining estimates, and more.
Use system notification layout rather than custom BatteryBot layout?

If enabled, the system notification layout will be used instead of BatteryBot\'s custom layout. The system layout is less customizable, but a small minority of devices don\'t report default colors properly, making the custom layout ugly or hard to read. Other devices use an unusual layout, making the custom layout not fit in. Selecting this option will ensure that the notification will look like any other notification.\n
\nNote that this will result in having the status bar icon used in the notification.

Android comes in many flavors, so there is no one perfect icon set that works well on every device. Pro users can use plugins to get more options, but there are now three built-in icon sets that should provide at least one good option for virtually every device.


"Classic" is the original icon set from 2009. It is still the best on older devices, but newer versions of Android (starting with Android 3.0, Honeycomb) shrink and dim the notification icons, making this set very difficult to read.


"Plain number" is the default for all newer Android devices. It is a very large white number that shows up well even after being shrunk and dimmed. It shows a lightning bolt under the number during charging.


"Smaller number" is like "Plain number" but smaller, because some newer devices do not actually shrink the icon like stock Android does, and the very large number in "Plain Number" can appear comically large on these devices.


If you have any BatteryBot Pro icon plugins installed (press MENU, then Get Plugins to get free plugins, or just press the Get Plugins button on the Action Bar on newer devices), you can choose among them here.
Show time since status changed rather than estimate of time remaining?

Enable this setting if you\'d prefer the main notification to show the time since the status changed (e.g., \"Unplugged for 5 hours\") rather than the estimate of time remaining. Both pieces of information are available from the main window.
Android reports the battery temperature in degrees Celsius. If you prefer to see the battery temperature in degrees Fahrenheit, check this option, and the app will convert for you.
